Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ascaphin-1 (natural AMPs; UCLL1c; XXA, frog, amphibians, vertebrates, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: Coastal Tailed Frog,Ascaphus truei, Pacific Northwest, USA, North America

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: C-terminally amidated form is more active. The amidated form is active against E. coli (MIC 3-6 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 25 uM), E. cloacae (MIC 6 uM), K. pneumoniae (MIC 6 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 50 uM), Streptococcus Group B (MIC 13 uM).Toxicity:  not hemo.lytic HC50 >200 uM. Updated 5/2020; 7/2020; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Conlon JM, Sonnevend A, Davidson C, Smith DD, Nielsen PF2004
Literature Information.Title: The ascaphins: a family of antimicrobial peptides from the skin secretions of the most primitive extant frog, Ascaphus truei.
